Topic.Title: Objects  in container will not show in game

Posts.EditableText: Hi everybody. I am just starting out with Quest and am following a tutorial I found on youtube to try to get some of the basics down. In the tutorial the instructor creates a container with a couple of children objects. When I follow his instructions the objects do not show when the box is opened. If I drag the items into the room I can interact with them. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Posts.HTML: Hi everybody. I am just starting out with Quest and am following a tutorial I found on youtube to try to get some of the basics down. In the tutorial the instructor creates a container with a couple of children objects. When I follow his instructions the objects do not show when the box is opened. If I drag the items into the room I can interact with them. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Posts.EditableText:
It should work. In order to work out what's wrong, I think we would need to take a look at your game.

Could you share the game somewhere? Or if you're on the desktop version of Quest, look at the container in full code view and copy all of the container here so we can see it (putting a line of 3 backticks (```) above and below the code so that the forum doesn't mangle it)
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: Are the objects visible? Make sure marking they are visible at their "Setup" tab.
Posts.HTML: Are the objects visible? Make sure marking they are visible at their "Setup" tab.

Posts.EditableText:
Have you ticked
List children when object is opened or examined?
Posts.HTML:
Have you ticked
List children when object is opened or examined?
